item.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Tactical Takedown launches May 22
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-tactical-takedown-launches-may-22

  • PC

Turn-based Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles game dated.

Turn-based Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles game Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Tactical Takedown will launch for PC via Steam on May 22, developer Strange Scaffold announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Tactical Takedown is the first-ever turn-based Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles video game. Inspired by the classic cartoon, you’ll experience a bold new approach to the world of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles! Splinter and Shredder are dead, and as the Turtles approach adulthood, they’re not just growing up… they’re growing apart.

Battle the Foot Clan as a powerful new leader takes control in action-packed campaigns that showcase each Turtle individually. Carve through enemies in 20 constantly-mutating levels that grow, shrink, and add new threats with each turn, inspired by classic Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles games! Rack up points for high scores while experiencing a powerful original Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles story from acclaimed indie studio Strange Scaffold. This is the next step for Michelangelo, Donatello, Leonardo, and Raphael—and you can experience it with flying, slashing figurines in graphic novel-inspired splendor.

Key Features

  • 20 action-packed levels, divided into campaigns focusing on individual characters.
  • A unique take on the world of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles from the minds at Strange Scaffold (Space Warlord Organ Trading Simulator, I Am Your Beast).
  • Innovative turn-based beat ’em up combat, complete with mutating arenas.
  • Gorgeous graphic novel-inspired art style, with paint splatter, figurines, and diorama setpieces.
  • Customizable movesets to shape each Turtles’ playstyle
  • Thumping multi-genre soundtrack from award-winning composer RJ Lake (Unbeatable, El Paso, Elsewhere).

item.title: Shadowverse: Worlds Beyond launches June 17
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/shadowverse-worlds-beyond-launches-june-17

  • PC
  • Smartphone

Pre-registration now available.

Free-to-play strategy card game Shadowverse: Worlds Beyond will launch for PC via Steam and Epic Games Store, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play on June 17, developer Cygames announced. It will support English, Japanese, Korean, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options. Pre-registration is available now and includes various in-game rewards.

Here is an overview of the game, via its store pages:

About

Shadowverse: Worlds Beyond is a brand-new strategy card game from the popular Shadowverse collectible card game.

With the newly added super-evolution mechanic and Shadowverse Park, among other brand-new content, there is lots to enjoy for both seasoned and brand-new players.

Key Features

  • Card Battles
    • The rules of Shadowverse are simple, yet offer limitless ways to strategize and win.
    • Use different card combinations to create unique synergies and strategies in battles against players all around the world.
    • Dive into the game and enjoy strategic card battles with breathtaking graphics and effects.
  • New Game Mechanic: Super-Evolution
    • Each of your followers (unit cards you play on the field) can now super-evolve!
    • Followers that have super-evolved are stronger and can knock opposing followers out with powerful attacks and deal damage straight to their leader!
    • Super-evolve your followers and enjoy exhilarating card battles like never before!
  • Class
    • Choose from seven unique classes that match your playstyle and create custom decks.
    • Tailor your deck to match your strategy and style, then dive into epic card battles!
  • Story
    • Experience a brand new Shadowverse story where characters are brought to life with full voice acting!
    • Follow spectacular stories centered around seven unique characters, each bringing their own personality to the adventure.
  • New Feature: Shadowverse Park
    • Step into the Shadowverse collectible card game community where players can connect and interact!
    • Show off your avatar with customizable outfits and emotes, bond with others, and grow stronger together!

Watch a new set of trailers below.

Suikoden I & II HD Remaster: Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars opens at 49,366 retail copies sold.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for the week of March 3, 2025 to March 9, 2025.

Monster Hunter Wilds for PlayStation 5 remained the top selling game last week following its debut the previous week, moving an additional 101,058 retail units.

Suikoden I & II HD Remaster: Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars was the highest selling new release of the week, opening at 38,884 sales on Switch and 10,482 sales on PlayStation 5 for an opening week total of 49,366 retail copies sold.

On the hardware side, the PlayStation 5 family sold 52,520 units, the Switch family sold 37,841 units, the Xbox Series family sold 559 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 22 units.

item.title: Red Thread Games announces mystery survival RPG Hello Sunshine for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/red-thread-games-announces-mystery-survival-rpg-hello-sunshine-for-pc

  • PC

Scavenge, craft, upgrade, and piece together the broken puzzle of a world ruled by machines.

Red Thread Games has announced Hello Sunshine, a mystery survival RPG set in the ruins of a corporate empire. It will be available for PC via Steam. A release date was not announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

“They sold us a brighter future. They delivered the end of the world.”

Hello Sunshine is a mystery survival RPG set in the sun-scorched ruins of a corporate empire. You play the final employee. Your mission: reach the tower at the end of the road, and help decide the fate of what remains of this world.

To survive the blistering heat and deadly sun, you’ll walk in the shadow of a towering war machine, scavenging for supplies and searching for pieces to the puzzle.

When the sun sets and the robot stops to charge, you’ll make camp, craft new gear, and repair your mechanical guardian. But the wasteland is freezing cold at night. Stay close to the robot to keep warm.

The journey to the tower is long. You won’t make it on your own. As the sun rises, the robot starts walking. Follow—and stay alive until the end of the road.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Key Features

  • Walk in the Shadow of a Giant Robot – The sun is your enemy. The robot’s shadow provides protection from the heat and radiation. Stay in the shade or risk exposure—but the further into the wasteland you venture, the greater the rewards.
  • Survive the Freezing Nights – The wasteland turns bitterly cold after sundown. After the robot stops to recharge at a Sunshine Service Station, you must stay close to keep warm. Make camp, cook food, craft new gear, upgrade your equipment—and keep an eye out for visiting strangers, for appearances can deceive.
  • Repair, Customize, and Upgrade Your Mobile Base – The wandering robot is more than a companion—it’s your lifeline. Enhance it with improved sensors, defensive systems, and mechanical upgrades. Add decals and personal touches, even a fresh coat of paint.
  • Build a Lasting Relationship With the Robot – At first, the colossus barely acknowledges you. Over time, your bond strengthens. Assist the robot with repairs, install upgrades, and unlock new ways to interact. In return, the metal giant will aid you on your journey—locating secrets hidden in the desert, lifting you past obstacles, shielding you from threats, fighting back against hostile war machines.
  • Scavenge, Craft, Progress – Salvage resources from supply drops and storage units, scavenge downed war machines, military stations and abandoned settlements. At night, use a Sunshine Recycler to break loot into base components, and craft gear, tools and weapons to improve your odds of survival.
  • Deploy your Little Guys – Assemble and program helper bots to automate and assist in common tasks like gathering resources, mapping terrain, hunting prey, and defending against drone attacks.
  • Piece Together the Mystery of a Broken World – Sunshine sold humanity a brighter future. Instead, the corporation left behind a wasteland of automated systems still waging war long after their creators vanished. Who is the Final Employee? What is the giant white tower at the end of the road? And what happens when the last machine remembers your name?
  • Rise in the Corporate Hierarchy – Complete menial tasks to gain employee levels and earn bonus points, unlocking vending machines, rest areas and self-care rooms, and other workplace perks from Sunshine’s automated service stations. After all, a dependable employee gets the best benefits!
  • Play Solo or Cooperatively – Team up with a friend (or workmate) to experience the journey from different perspectives. Coordinate scavenging runs, trade resources, and explore how your peculiar partnership shapes the unfolding narrative.

The sun is rising. The robot is moving. Keep walking.

Watch the announcement teaser trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land demo launches March 17
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/atelier-yumia-the-alchemist-of-memories-the-envisioned-land-demo-launches-march-17

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Save data from the demo can be carried over to the full game.

Publisher Koei Tecmo and developer Gust will release a demo for Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land on March 17, the companies announced.

The demo will allow you to play from the prologue to the early game main quest “Pioneering the Ligneus Region,” experiencing gathering ingredients on the field, battles, synthesis, and building. Save data from the demo can be carried over to the full game.

Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on March 21 worldwide.
